SUC.title: Questions 16-20
SUC.description: Complete the summary below. Write NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS from the passage for each answer.

question_data.title: The Life Cycle of Salmon
question_data.text: Salmon begin their lives in freshwater <input> where they hatch from eggs. After spending several months in the river, young salmon undergo a process called <input> which prepares them for life in the ocean. They then migrate to the <input> where they spend most of their adult lives feeding and growing. When ready to reproduce, salmon return to their <input> using their remarkable sense of smell. The journey upstream is extremely <input>, and many salmon die after spawning.

questions.question_text: Salmon begin their lives in freshwater <input>
a process called <input> which prepares them

SUC_WITH_WORDLIST.title: Questions 36-40
SUC_WITH_WORDLIST.description: Complete the summary using the list of words, A-I, below.

question_data.title: The Development of Writing Systems
question_data.text: The earliest writing systems emerged around 3200 BCE in <input>. These initial scripts were primarily used for <input> purposes such as recording trade transactions. Over time, writing evolved from simple <input> representing objects to more abstract symbols. The invention of the <input> around 1500 BCE made writing more accessible as it required memorizing fewer symbols. This development significantly increased <input> rates across ancient societies.

questions.question_text: The invention of the <input> around 1500 BCE

FCC.title: Questions 15-20
FCC.description: Complete the flow chart below. Write NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS for each answer.

question_data.title: Coffee Production Process
question_data.flow_description: The flow chart shows the main stages in coffee production from harvesting to packaging.

steps.text: Coffee cherries are <input> when they turn red
Cherries are processed using either the <input> or wet method

processed using either the ___ or wet method
dried until moisture content reaches ___%
Outer layers removed during ___ process

TFNG.title: Questions 8-13
TFNG.description: Do the following statements agree with the information given in the passage? Write TRUE if the statement agrees with the information, FALSE if the statement contradicts the information, NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this.

questions.text: The first electric cars were developed in the late 19th century.
Electric vehicles are more expensive to maintain than petrol cars.
The government plans to ban all petrol cars by 2030.
Battery technology has improved significantly in recent years.
Most charging stations are located in rural areas.
Electric car sales will exceed petrol car sales by 2025.

YNNG.title: Questions 1-6
YNNG.description: Do the following statements agree with the views of the writer in the passage? Write YES if the statement agrees with the views of the writer, NO if the statement contradicts the views of the writer, NOT GIVEN if it is impossible to say what the writer thinks about this.

questions.text: The author believes that social media has had a positive impact on society.
According to the writer, young people spend too much time online.
The writer thinks that governments should regulate social media platforms.
The author suggests that face-to-face communication is becoming obsolete.
The writer believes that social media companies prioritize user safety.
According to the author, older generations understand the risks of social media.

MH.title: Questions 1-7
MH.description: The passage has seven paragraphs, A-G. Choose the correct heading for each paragraph from the list of headings below.

options.label: The decline of traditional farming methods
The impact of climate change on crop yields
Organic farming as a sustainable alternative
The global demand for food production
The role of education in farming communities

question_data.note: NB There are more headings than paragraphs, so you will not use them all.

questions.text: Paragraph A
Paragraph B
Paragraph C
Paragraph D
Paragraph E
Paragraph F
Paragraph G

example.question: Paragraph A
example.explanation: Paragraph A discusses how agriculture contributes to the national economy and provides employment.

MI.title: Questions 14-19
MI.description: Which paragraph contains the following information? Write the correct letter, A-H, in boxes 14-19 on your answer sheet. NB You may use any letter more than once.

questions.text: A reference to the financial investment required for space exploration
An explanation of why some scientists oppose certain missions
Details of a recent breakthrough in propulsion technology
A comparison between different space agencies' approaches
The potential benefits for life on Earth
Historical context for current space programs

MF.title: Questions 20-25
MF.description: Look at the following statements and the list of researchers below. Match each statement with the correct researcher, A-E. Write the correct letter, A-E, in boxes 20-25 on your answer sheet. NB You may use any letter more than once.

questions.text: Language acquisition is primarily influenced by environmental factors.
Children learn grammar through imitation of adult speech.
There is a critical period for language development.
Bilingual children show cognitive advantages over monolingual peers.
Language learning ability declines sharply after puberty.
Social interaction is essential for language development.

questions.text: What type of material is used to construct the outer shell of the building?

DL.title: Questions 31-35
DL.description: Label the diagram below. Write NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS for each answer.

question_data.title: Cross-Section of a Wind Turbine
question_data.visual_description: The diagram shows a cross-section of a horizontal axis wind turbine with labeled parts including the rotor blades, nacelle, tower, and foundation. Arrows indicate the direction of wind flow and the rotation of components.

labels.name: Component that converts kinetic energy to electrical energy
Housing that contains the main mechanical components
Structure that supports the entire turbine

questions.text: Component that converts kinetic energy to electrical energy
Housing that contains the main mechanical components
System that adjusts blade angle
Component that increases rotational speed
Structure that supports the entire turbine

MCQ.answer_format: Single letter: A, B, C, or D
common_errors: Including option text instead of just the letter
validation_rules: correct_answer must be exactly one uppercase letter
choices array must have 3-4 options with 'key' and 'text'
Only one choice should be correct

MCMA.answer_format: Concatenated letters without spaces: ACE, BDF, ABDE
common_errors: Using commas or spaces between letters (A, C, E instead of ACE)
validation_rules: correct_answer must be 2+ uppercase letters concatenated
Letters should be in alphabetical order (ACE not CAE)

TFNG.answer_format: Exact uppercase: TRUE, FALSE, or NOT GIVEN
validation_rules: Answers must be exactly: TRUE, FALSE, or NOT GIVEN
Check if statement can be verified from passage facts

YNNG.answer_format: Exact uppercase: YES, NO, or NOT GIVEN
validation_rules: Answers must be exactly: YES, NO, or NOT GIVEN
Check if statement reflects writer's opinion

SC.answer_format: Word(s) from passage, alternatives separated by |
common_errors: Confusing with SUC (sentences should be INDEPENDENT)
validation_rules: Sentences can be reordered without losing meaning

common_errors: Confusing with SC (check for pronoun chains)
Missing word_list when word bank is provided
Using word instead of letter when word_list exists
validation_rules: Pronoun chains present (The hotel... It... Guests...)
If word_list provided, answer must be the LETTER not word

NC.answer_format: Word(s) for each blank in hierarchical structure
common_errors: Flat structure instead of nested items
Using 'prefix' instead of 'title' for section headers
validation_rules: Items can be strings or nested objects with 'title'/'items'
Cells can be strings or arrays for multi-line content

FC.answer_format: Word(s) or number for form fields
common_errors: Using 'prefix' instead of 'title' for section headers
Not including example if one is provided
validation_rules: Include 'example' field if PDF provides one

common_errors: Missing step numbers or flow description
Treating as regular completion instead of process
validation_rules: Steps should be in logical order

MH.answer_format: Roman numeral: i, ii, iii, iv, v, vi, vii, viii, ix, x
common_errors: Using Arabic numerals (1, 2, 3) instead of Roman
Using uppercase Roman numerals (I, II, III)
Not having more headings than paragraphs
validation_rules: Answers must be lowercase Roman numerals
options array should have MORE headings than paragraphs

MI.answer_format: Uppercase paragraph letter: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
common_errors: Not noting that letters can be reused
validation_rules: Same letter may be used more than once

MF.answer_format: Letter matching person/theory: A, B, C, D, E
common_errors: Not extracting all people/theories from passage
validation_rules: Answer is letter corresponding to person/theory
Same letter may be used more than once

ML.answer_format: Letter from map: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I
common_errors: Using location names instead of letters
Confusing with ML (DL uses words, ML uses letters)
